element_scores.name: Dataset Discovery and Identification
element_scores.description: Can a user or system discover and uniquely identify this dataset?

sub_elements.name: Persistent Identifier (DOI, RRID, or URI)
sub_elements.evidence: id: https://chorus4ai.org/
sub_elements.quality_note: URI present as persistent identifier, though not a DOI or RRID. The URL serves as a stable identifier for the dataset
sub_elements.semantic_validation: URI format valid but not a formal DOI or RRID

sub_elements.name: Dataset Title and Description Completeness
sub_elements.evidence: title: Patient-Focused Collaborative Hospital Repository Uniting Standards (CHoRUS) for Equitable AI; description: 600+ character comprehensive description covering scope, data types, institutions, ethical approach, and scale
sub_elements.quality_note: Excellent title and comprehensive multi-paragraph description covering all key aspects including purpose, scale (100,000+ patients, 20 centers), data types (multi-modal EHR, waveforms, imaging, EEG, notes), standards (OMOP), and ethical considerations
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Title and description are comprehensive, detailed, and informative

sub_elements.name: Keywords or Tags for Searchability
sub_elements.evidence: keywords: 31 entries including 'CHoRUS', 'Bridge2AI', 'critical care', 'acute illness', 'OMOP Common Data Model', 'EHR', 'waveform telemetry', 'medical imaging', 'health equity', 'federated access', 'ethical AI', 'trustworthy AI', domain-specific terms
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive keyword list covering project name, data types, standards, ethical principles, data modalities, and clinical domains
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Keywords comprehensive covering technical, clinical, ethical, and methodological dimensions

sub_elements.name: Landing Page and Resources (page, hierarchical resources)
sub_elements.evidence: page: https://chorus4ai.org/; external_resources includes multiple CHoRUS resources (website, GitHub org, documentation, developer resources)
sub_elements.quality_note: Landing page URL provided with extensive external resources; no hierarchical resources field but comprehensive external resource documentation
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Landing page present; hierarchical resources structure not used but compensated by external_resources

sub_elements.name: Hierarchical Structure (parent datasets, relationships)
sub_elements.evidence: No parent_datasets or related_datasets fields found
sub_elements.quality_note: Missing hierarchical structure fields - dataset appears standalone without explicit parent/child relationships or typed connections to other Bridge2AI datasets
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Schema fields parent_datasets and related_datasets not populated

element_scores.name: Dataset Access and Retrieval
element_scores.description: Can the dataset and its associated resources be located, accessed, and downloaded?

sub_elements.name: Access Policy and IP Restrictions Defined
sub_elements.evidence: license_and_use_terms: CHoRUS Controlled Access License with detailed description of registration requirements (institutional email, signed licensing agreement, approval process), contact emails provided; ip_restrictions field not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive controlled access policy documented with clear requirements and contact information; IP restrictions not explicitly documented in separate schema field
sub_elements.semantic_validation: License terms comprehensive but ip_restrictions field missing

sub_elements.name: Regulatory Restrictions and Confidentiality Level Specified
sub_elements.evidence: Ethical and legal frameworks mentioned in description and human_subject_research, but regulatory_restrictions and confidentiality_level schema fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Privacy and ethical considerations discussed narratively but not captured in structured regulatory_restrictions or confidentiality_level fields
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Regulatory frameworks mentioned in prose but not in dedicated schema fields

sub_elements.name: Download URL or Platform Link Available
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats.access_urls: https://chorus4ai.org/ (appears in 5 format entries); page: https://chorus4ai.org/; contact emails for access requests
sub_elements.quality_note: CHoRUS website provided in distribution_formats access URLs and page field; secure enclave access implied but specific download_url field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Access URLs present in distribution formats pointing to CHoRUS platform

sub_elements.name: Distribution Formats and File Types Specified
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats: 5 entries (OMOP Common Data Model, WFDB waveform format, DICOM imaging format, OHNLP tokenized text, EDF+/Persyst EEG formats) with descriptions and access information
sub_elements.quality_note: Multiple distribution formats clearly specified covering all data modalities with standard formats (OMOP, WFDB, DICOM, OHNLP, EDF+, Persyst)
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Distribution formats comprehensive and well-documented with standard data formats

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets and External Resources Linked
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources: 10 entries including CHoRUS website, GitHub organization, documentation, OHDSI community, published research, contact emails, NIH RePORTER, Bridge2AI program, AIM-AHEAD partnership; related_datasets field not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive external resources covering project infrastructure, standards communities, publications, funding; no typed relationships to related datasets
sub_elements.semantic_validation: External resources comprehensive; related_datasets field not used

element_scores.name: Data Reuse and Interoperability
element_scores.description: Is sufficient information provided to reuse and integrate the dataset with others?

sub_elements.name: License Terms Allow Reuse
sub_elements.evidence: license_and_use_terms: CHoRUS Controlled Access License specifies data use agreement, permitted research uses, ethical/legal compliance requirements
sub_elements.quality_note: License explicitly supports research reuse under controlled access with clear terms governing permitted uses and compliance requirements
sub_elements.semantic_validation: License permits research reuse with appropriate controlled access safeguards

sub_elements.name: Data Formats Are Standardized (encoding, format)
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats specify OMOP, WFDB, DICOM, OHNLP, EDF+, Persyst - all recognized international standards; format/encoding top-level fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: All data modalities use internationally recognized standard formats (OMOP for EHR, WFDB for waveforms, DICOM for imaging, OHNLP for text, EDF+/Persyst for EEG); demonstrates strong standardization commitment
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Formats highly standardized using community standards but not in top-level format/encoding fields

sub_elements.name: Schema or Ontology Conformance Stated
sub_elements.evidence: preprocessing_strategies and distribution_formats reference OMOP Common Data Model, DICOM schema, WFDB/PhysioNet schema, OHNLP schema, EDF+ schema, Persyst schema; conforms_to field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Multiple schema conformances documented throughout (OMOP CDM, DICOM, WFDB extended PhysioNet, OHNLP, EDF+, Persyst) but not in conforms_to field
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Schema conformances extensively documented in narratives but conforms_to field missing

sub_elements.name: Variable Metadata with Identifiers Defined
sub_elements.evidence: OMOP schema metadata mentioned as 'published' but variables field (as schema list) not populated; no explicit variable-level documentation in D4D file
sub_elements.quality_note: OMOP schema referenced externally but variable-level metadata not included in D4D file; variables schema field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Variable documentation deferred to external OMOP schema

sub_elements.name: Use Guidance Provided (intended, prohibited uses)
sub_elements.evidence: intended_uses: 5 entries (AI/ML model development, external validation, health equity research, clinical care improvement, educational/training); discouraged_uses: 3 entries (uses during ongoing collection, clinical decision-making without validation, re-identification attempts); prohibited_uses field not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive use guidance with intended and discouraged uses clearly delineated; no explicit prohibited_uses field
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Use guidance comprehensive covering recommendations and warnings

element_scores.name: Ethical Use and Privacy Safeguards
element_scores.description: Does the dataset provide clear information about consent, privacy, and ethical oversight?

sub_elements.name: IRB or Ethics Review Documented
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research: IRB approval from institutional review boards at 14 data acquisition centers, community-facing ethics focus groups, legal and ethical advisory teams; ethical_reviews as list field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Ethics review comprehensively documented with IRB approvals at all 14 sites, community ethics engagement, multidisciplinary ethical oversight; ethical_reviews list field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Ethics review extensively documented but in human_subject_research rather than ethical_reviews list

sub_elements.name: Deidentification Method Described
sub_elements.evidence: preprocessing_strategies (preproc-005): 'Data re-identification limitation' with privacy-preserving transformations, de-identification algorithms, risk assessment; cleaning_strategies reference de-identification; is_deidentified field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: De-identification documented across preprocessing and cleaning strategies with multiple approaches; is_deidentified class field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: De-identification thoroughly documented in preprocessing/cleaning strategies

sub_elements.name: Privacy Protections Beyond Deidentification
sub_elements.evidence: preprocessing_strategies document privacy-preserving transformations, community ethics focus groups input, re-identification limitation approaches; controlled access model in license_and_use_terms; participant_privacy field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Multiple privacy layers: de-identification, controlled access, community ethics input, prohibition on re-identification attempts, legal framework; participant_privacy schema field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Privacy protections extensive and multilayered but not in structured participant_privacy field

sub_elements.name: Informed Consent Obtained from Participants
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research describes ethics processes but does not explicitly mention informed consent procedures; informed_consent field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Retrospective data collection from EHR systems; consent procedures not explicitly documented in human_subject_research or informed_consent fields
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Consent documentation not present; retrospective collection may use different consent model

sub_elements.name: Vulnerable Populations and Compensation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: No vulnerable_populations or participant_compensation fields; critically ill patients are vulnerable population but not explicitly documented as such
sub_elements.quality_note: Critically ill patients inherently vulnerable but not explicitly documented; compensation not applicable for retrospective EHR collection
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Vulnerable populations and compensation fields not populated

element_scores.name: Data Composition and Structure
element_scores.description: Can the dataset's structure, modality, and population be understood from metadata?

sub_elements.name: Cohort or Subpopulations Characteristics Described
sub_elements.evidence: subpopulations: 2 entries (critically ill patients by hospital - 14 hospitals; patients with complete multi-modal data); instances describes critically ill patients across ICU settings
sub_elements.quality_note: Subpopulations describe geographic/institutional diversity and data completeness stratification; clinical population clearly characterized as critically ill patients in ICU settings
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Subpopulations documented with institutional and data completeness dimensions

sub_elements.name: Number of Instances or Samples Reported
sub_elements.evidence: instances: 'As of November 2024, dataset covers 14 different hospitals with 23,400 unique admissions. Target enrollment exceeds 100,000 critically ill patients.'
sub_elements.quality_note: Clear instance counts provided: current status (23,400 admissions) and target (100,000+ patients) with temporal context (Nov 2024)
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Instance counts clearly stated with current status and targets

sub_elements.name: Variable-Level Metadata and Tabular Flag
sub_elements.evidence: OMOP schema metadata referenced as 'published' and available but not included in D4D file; variables and is_tabular fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Variable metadata deferred to external OMOP documentation; tabular nature implied by OMOP structure but is_tabular field not set
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Variable metadata external; schema fields not used

sub_elements.name: Data Topics or Conditions Represented
sub_elements.evidence: instances: 'acute and critical care illness' and 'critically ill patients requiring acute or critical care admitted to intensive care units'; purposes address improving recovery from acute illness
sub_elements.quality_note: Data topics clearly defined as acute and critical care illness across diverse patient conditions and treatment strategies
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Clinical topics and conditions clearly characterized

sub_elements.name: Data Quality Issues and Anomalies Documented
sub_elements.evidence: sampling_strategies: federated multi-center sampling with is_sample: true, is_random: false, is_representative: true; cleaning_strategies document quality assurance; anomalies field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Sampling characteristics well-documented; quality assurance mentioned in cleaning strategies; no explicit anomalies documentation
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Sampling documented; quality processes mentioned; anomalies field missing

element_scores.name: Data Provenance and Version Tracking
element_scores.description: Can a user determine dataset versions, update history, and provenance?

sub_elements.name: Dataset Version Number Provided
sub_elements.evidence: updates describes ongoing data collection through November 2026 but no explicit version numbers; version field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Updates describe continuous expansion (23,400 admissions as of Nov 2024, target 100,000+) but no formal version numbering scheme
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Version numbering not present; continuous updates model

sub_elements.name: Version Access Methods Documented
sub_elements.evidence: No version_access field; updates describe ongoing collection but not version access mechanisms
sub_elements.quality_note: Version access methods not documented; access via controlled enclave but version-specific access not addressed
sub_elements.semantic_validation: version_access field not populated

sub_elements.name: Change Descriptions and Errata Provided
sub_elements.evidence: updates.update_details: current status (23,400 admissions Nov 2024), target (100,000+), site status tracking via GitHub/Google Forms, GitHub project tracking, documentation updates, semantic mapping expansion; errata field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Update tracking documented via GitHub project management and site status reporting; errata field not used but updates describe ongoing changes
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Update processes documented; errata field missing

sub_elements.name: Update Schedule or Frequency Indicated
sub_elements.evidence: updates.frequency: 'Continuous updates through November 2026'; project timeline extends through November 30, 2026 with no-cost extension approved
sub_elements.quality_note: Update frequency clearly stated as continuous with defined end date (Nov 2026); regular site status updates tracked
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Update schedule documented with project timeline

sub_elements.name: Provenance and Source Derivation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: D4D header comments: 'Source: data/preprocessed/concatenated/CHORUS_preprocessed.txt (79K, 7 source files)'; collection_mechanisms describe retrospective EHR extraction from 14 centers; was_derived_from and release_notes fields not populated

sub_elements.semantic_validation: Provenance in metadata header and narratives but not in schema fields

sub_elements.evidence: purposes: 4 detailed entries (improve recovery from acute illness, create AI-ready critical care dataset, establish data standards and tools, promote diversity and health equity)

sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive grant details including grant number, opportunity number, study section, fiscal year, and funding amount

sub_elements.name: Creators and Acknowledgements Documented

element_scores.name: Technical Transparency (Data Collection and Processing)

sub_elements.quality_note: Collection mechanisms comprehensively documented covering all data modalities with technical details (PACS for imaging, gateway/middleware for waveforms, EHR systems, EEG databases)

issues_detected.description: Many optional schema fields not populated despite relevant information existing in other fields or narratives
issues_detected.recommendation: Consider populating optional schema fields to improve machine-readability, semantic interoperability, and structured metadata completeness

issues_detected.description: Important information often embedded in narrative fields rather than structured schema fields
issues_detected.recommendation: Extract structured information from narratives into dedicated schema fields when available for better machine processing

issues_detected.description: Dataset limitations, biases, and anomalies not explicitly documented in dedicated schema fields
issues_detected.recommendation: Add explicit limitations documentation covering: (1) ongoing data collection completeness, (2) multi-center harmonization challenges, (3) sampling non-randomness (federated selection), (4) generalizability across different ICU settings, (5) data availability by modality (imaging/EEG still in process), (6) institutional variability in EHR systems and clinical practices

issues_detected.description: Dataset lacks formal persistent identifier (DOI or RRID), using URL instead
issues_detected.recommendation: Consider obtaining DOI for dataset (e.g., via Zenodo, institutional repository) to improve long-term citability and persistent identification

issues_detected.description: Informed consent procedures not explicitly documented for retrospective EHR collection
issues_detected.recommendation: Document consent model for retrospective data collection (waiver of consent, opt-out mechanisms, institutional policies) to clarify ethical framework

issues_detected.description: No formal version numbering scheme despite continuous data updates
issues_detected.recommendation: Implement version numbering system for dataset snapshots to enable reproducibility and version-specific citations

semantic_analysis.semantic_insights: CHORUS D4D datasheet demonstrates exceptional technical transparency and comprehensive documentation of a complex multi-center, multi-modal critical care dataset. The dataset achieves 38/50 points (76%) primarily through detailed narrative documentation across motivation (5/5), technical transparency (5/5), funding transparency (5/5), composition (4/5), discovery (4/5), access (4/5), and reuse (4/5). Key strengths include: (1) exhaustive data acquisition documentation across 5 modalities with standardized formats (OMOP, DICOM, WFDB, OHNLP, EDF+/Persyst), (2) strong standards conformance and interoperability commitment via internationally recognized schemas, (3) comprehensive multi-level ethics oversight (14 IRBs, community focus groups, legal/ethical advisory), (4) detailed preprocessing/cleaning/labeling strategies, (5) extensive external resource ecosystem (28 GitHub repos, documentation sites, standards communities), (6) clear controlled access model with registration/licensing requirements. Primary weaknesses: (1) no formal persistent identifier (DOI/RRID - uses URL), (2) limitations/biases/anomalies not explicitly documented despite ongoing collection and multi-center complexity, (3) no formal version tracking despite continuous updates, (4) consent procedures unclear for retrospective EHR collection, (5) many optional schema fields unpopulated despite relevant narrative information. The datasheet represents a tension between comprehensive prose documentation (excellent) and structured metadata completeness (moderate). Opportunities: formalize version tracking, obtain DOI, document limitations/biases explicitly, clarify consent model, populate structured schema fields for machine-readability, link to related Bridge2AI datasets with typed relationships.

recommendations: Obtain DOI for dataset via appropriate repository (Zenodo, institutional, or domain-specific) to enable persistent identification and formal citation
Add RRID if applicable for additional identifier support and life sciences repository integration
Populate version field with current version/snapshot number and implement formal versioning scheme for continuous updates
Add version_access class documenting how users access specific dataset versions or snapshots

Create known_limitations field documenting: (1) ongoing collection status and completeness, (2) multi-center harmonization challenges, (3) non-random federated sampling, (4) generalizability across different ICU types, (5) variable data availability by modality (imaging/EEG in process), (6) institutional EHR system variability

Add known_biases field identifying: (1) academic medical center bias (14 university-affiliated centers), (2) geographic bias (US-only), (3) temporal bias (specific collection period), (4) clinical bias (ICU patients not general population)
Document informed_consent procedures and model for retrospective EHR collection (waiver rationale, opt-out mechanisms, institutional policies)
Add vulnerable_populations entry for critically ill patients with ethical considerations for this inherently vulnerable population
Add publisher field: 'CHoRUS Consortium / National Institutes of Health Bridge2AI Program'
Create formatted citation field for standard reference in publications
Add conforms_to field listing: OMOP Common Data Model, DICOM, WFDB (extended PhysioNet schema), OHNLP, EDF+, Persyst, OHDSI standards, FAIR principles
Populate conforms_to_schema with structured references to schema versions used
Add variables field with structured variable metadata (can reference external OMOP documentation but provide summary)
Add is_tabular field based on OMOP structured format
Add format and encoding fields for top-level dataset characteristics
Create is_deidentified class instance documenting de-identification methodology and privacy transformations

Add participant_privacy list documenting: (1) de-identification approaches, (2) controlled access model, (3) re-identification prohibition, (4) community ethics input, (5) privacy-preserving transformations
Create ethical_reviews list with entries for each of 14 IRB approvals including institutions and approval scope
Add regulatory_restrictions and confidentiality_level based on HIPAA framework and controlled access requirements
Add prohibited_uses field distinguishing prohibited from discouraged uses (e.g., commercial use restrictions, re-identification prohibition)
Add related_datasets entries with typed relationships to other Bridge2AI datasets (AI-READI, VOICE, CM4AI) and parent Bridge2AI program
Create software_and_tools list extracting from narratives: OHDSI tool stack, OHNLP toolkit, chorus_waveform, privacy_scan_tool, chorus-container-apps, visualization/annotation environment
Add anomalies field if quality issues identified during multi-center harmonization and validation
Add content_warnings field if sensitive clinical content requires user warnings beyond general sensitive_elements
Document participant_compensation (likely not applicable for retrospective collection but clarify)
Add was_derived_from documenting retrospective EHR extraction provenance
Add errata field for tracking data quality issues or corrections discovered post-release
Consider adding parent_datasets or hierarchical resources structure if dataset has logical subdivisions (by site, by modality, by time period)
